entry.value: library(ggplot2)%%00010library(grid)%%00010x = knime.in$"Children_GFP_Particles_Count";%%00010y = knime.in$"Intensity_MeanIntensity_TRITC";%%00010head(x)%%00010head(y)%%00010correlation = cor(y,x);%%00010# Multiple Linear Regression%%00010fit <- lm(y ~ x)%%00010head(fit)%%00010%%00010slope = fit[2]%%00010plot_data <- data.frame(x, y)%%00010p <- ggplot(plot_data, aes(x = Green, y = Red, colour = group))%%00010# add points%%00010p <- p + geom_point(aes(x = plot_data$x, y = plot_data$y, colour = plot_data$group), size = I(2), alpha = I(0.3)) + scale_colour_hue(l=60, c=150, guide = guide_legend(ncol = 2, title.hjust = 0.5, label.theme = element_text(size = 16, angle = 0)))%%00010p <- p + xlim(0, 75) + ylim(0, 0.75)%%00010p <- p + geom_abline(intercept = intercept, slope = slope)%%00010 # remove background and grid%%00010p <- p + theme(panel.grid.major = element_blank(), panel.grid.minor = element_blank(), panel.background = element_blank())%%00010p <- p + theme(axis.line = element_line(colour = "black", size = 1))%%00010%%00010# change font size%%00010p <- p + theme(text = element_text(size=26, face = "bold"))%%00010# adjust margins %%00010p <- p + theme(plot.margin = unit(c(3,0,3,0), "cm"))%%00010#ggsave(file=save_file, plot=p, width=10, height=6)%%00010save_file_png <-paste("C:\\Users\\Robert\\Desktop\\KNIMEAnalysis\\", "ScatterPlot", ".png", sep="")%%00010ggsave(file=save_file_png, plot=p, width=5, height=10)%%00010save_file_pdf <-paste("C:\\Users\\Robert\\Desktop\\KNIMEAnalysis\\", "ScatterPlot", ".pdf", sep="")%%00010ggsave(file=save_file_pdf, plot=p, width=5, height=10)%%00010%%00010 print(p);%%00010%%00010 #p <- %%00010#p <- p + geom_text(data = data.frame(), aes(4.5, 30, label = "Pearson-R = 0.8185055"))%%00010#print(p);%%00010%%00010

entry.key: Output non numbers (NaN, Inf, -Inf) as missing cells
